message: Initial commit

Scaffold flask application

As generated by:
    cookiecutter https://github.com/candidtim/cookiecutter-flask-minimal.git

Signed-off-by: Luiz Carvalho <lucarval@redhat.com>

Cleanup cookiecutter bonanza

Signed-off-by: Luiz Carvalho <lucarval@redhat.com>
Reorganize cachito to use the web and workers subpackages
Add the ability to fetch the source code from the requests API endpoint

Add shared dir config

The shared directory is used to share data between the workers and the
API frontend.

Signed-off-by: Luiz Carvalho <lucarval@redhat.com>

Add API endpoint for listing all requests

Signed-off-by: Luiz Carvalho <lucarval@redhat.com>

Add support for user authentication

This implementation relies on a web server that supplies the
`REMOTE_USER` environment variable when the user is properly
authenticated. A common deployment option is using httpd
(Apache web server) with the `mod_auth_gssapi` module.
Document the cachito_auth_type configuration

Add information about pre-built container images

Signed-off-by: Luiz Carvalho <lucarval@redhat.com>

Document usage of master container registry tag

Quay is supposed to tag images as latest if it's building from the
default branch, i.e. master. This is currently not happening when a
custom git build trigger is used. A PR has been filed to fix this
behavior. If/when approved and deployed, we should revert this commit.

Quay is currently closed source so not all will have access to its
private repo:
    https://github.com/quay/quay/pull/3530

Signed-off-by: Luiz Carvalho <lucarval@redhat.com>
Prefix MAX_PER_PAGE with CACHITO to be consistent
Alphabetize the configuration section of the read me
Add missing documentation about how to configure Cachito

Revert "Document usage of master container registry tag"

This reverts commit f8a0f4226b0f01baaedfb124bb8c81a134af7373.

Remove "Experimental" references from docs

Signed-off-by: Luiz Carvalho <lucarval@redhat.com>

Update docs for running locally

Signed-off-by: Luiz Carvalho <lucarval@redhat.com>

Use make to clean up local deployment

Signed-off-by: Luiz Carvalho <lucarval@redhat.com>

Create the bundle in the archives dir

This makes it so that the download API endpoint doesn't wait for
a worker to assemble the bundle. Instead, once the request is complete,
the bundle will be present in the archives directory. This will prevent
timeouts on large projects and it will address the unstable behavior
seen on NFS volumes.
Document how to use a Kerberos keytab on the workers

Split up the location where sources and bundles are stored

This will prevent potential conflicts of names and it will keep
the volume more organized for future use-cases.
Make the HTTP timeouts on the worker configurable
Add an OpenAPI spec to document the REST API
Move up the API documentation section in the read me
Allow privileged users to submit a request on behalf of another user
Fix the documentation for CACHITO_WORKER_USERNAMES
Use Python black to format the code
Lint the docstrings with flake8-docstrings

Add support for the npm package manager

For now, only dependencies from the npm registry are supported. Any dependencies
in the package lock file that is directly from a URL, GitHub, Git repo, or
etc. is not supported.

Add support for non-registry npm dependencies

This is limited to popular SCM services such as GitHub, Git repos,
and HTTP(S) URLS.
Consistently use the term "gomod" when referring to the Go module package manager

Mark stuck in_progress requests as stale in the cachito-cleanup script

This also adds a timeout to the GET requests, additional logging,
and error handling.

Add support for npm dependencies from private repositories

This documents how authentication works to private repositories
and it keeps `npm pack` from prompting to trust unknown hosts.
Describe how Nexus should be configured for npm

Allow using a separate Nexus instance for the permanently stored content

This is useful if your organization already has a shared Nexus instance but
doesn't want Cachito to have near admin level access on it.

Resolves CLOUDBLD-1138
Alphabetize cachito/workers/config.py

Allow the Nexus repository names to be configurable

This allows for multiple instances of Cachito to use the same Nexus
instances.
Alphabetize the API configuration in the read me

Remove the auto-detect feature

This is done to prevent requests that previously worked to
fail if a new package manager is enabled. If no package
manager is supplied in a request, a configurable default value
is used. This configuration defaults to `["gomod"]`.

Add a configuration to set default environment variables

These can be set for each package manager. Some defaults were
added to npm to prevent certain post install scripts from reaching
out to the internet.

Use npm instead of js in the proxy repository for npm requests

In the future, if a package manager such as yarn is added, we would
want that to be a separate repo name in the event a Git repo
contains both npm and yarn.

Allow workers to authenticate with SSL certificate

This can be used as an alternative to completely disabling
authentication requirements for environments without kerberos support

* See https://requests.readthedocs.io/en/master/user/advanced/#client-side-certificates

Signed-off-by: Athos Ribeiro <athos@redhat.com>

Update Cachito description

Fixes #171

Signed-off-by: Luiz Carvalho <lucarval@redhat.com>
Capitalize Cachito in the read me
Update README for fixing mdlint inconsistencies
Add database migration instructions to README

Vendor gomod dependencies

A data migration is added for adding gomod-vendor flag. When the flag is set, it vendors the dependencies. Another cachito worker config is added to disable/enable cachito strict mode. If the strict mode is enabled and vendor directory exists, cachito requests are failed.
Document accessing private repositories during development

Add a configuration to ignore missing go.mod files

This is useful if the user erroneously specifies the "gomod"
package manager in a Cachito request when the repository
is not a Go module project.

This is also useful if the default package manager is set to
"gomod" and you want to allow users to make requests without
any package managers and would like them not to need to explicitly
set `"pkg_managers": []` in their request.

Add an allow list of npm file dependencies

One project that Cachito must support is a plugin
for Kui, which must specify its configuration via
an npm dependency. This project wants to use a file
dependency for this to avoid a separate repository.
Since this is a special case, this should be allowed.

Resolves CLOUDBLD-1533

Add support for env var kind

* CLOUDBLD-1484

Signed-off-by: arewm <arewm@users.noreply.github.com>

Allow package managers to be mutually exclusive

* CLOUDBLD-3309

Add config option `CACHITO_MUTUALLY_EXCLUSIVE_PACKAGE_MANAGERS`, which
is a list of pairs of mutually exclusive package managers. If a pair of
package managers is configured as mutually exclusive, then Cachito will
validate that they do not process the same package in a request.

The exception is git-submodule. For git-submodule, we always process all
submodules, so we cannot rely on the request configuration to know which
paths are git submodules. If A is mutually exclusive with git-submodule
and both A and git-submodule are present in the request, then A is only
allowed to process the root package, no subpaths.

Use this flag to make Cachito set CGO_ENABLED=0 while processing gomod
packages. Typically, you will only want to use this if your package
*does* use C files and the Cachito request is failing. Correct results
not guaranteed.

Retry gomod download operations

CLOUDBLD-2215

When `go mod download` or `go mod vendor` returns a non-zero code for
any reason, the operation will be retried. The max number of tries is
configurable.

Retries and giving up will be logged automatically by the `backoff`
library.

This change performs data clean up.
To delete the tables a new database
argument `delete_data=True` should be used.

Uses shallow clones as default for Git operations

This is to avoid exhausting the resources while cloning very large
repos (such as github.com/openshift/origin, which consumes ~3GB
memory).

In case the "include-git-dir" flag is set, a deep clone will still
be used.

Change behavior of symlink check in the target repository

If flag 'remove-unsafe-symlinks' is set, Cachito instead of raising exception

Signed-off-by: Serhii Tsymbaliuk <stsymbal@redhat.com>

Add force-gomod-tidy flag to force run go mod tidy

CLOUDBLD-8090

The reason for adding this flag is because of a dependency pruning feature
added to Go 1.17. For compatibility reasons, the "go mod tidy" command
always runs the algorithm of the previous Go version. As a result, the
dependencies fetched with "go mod download" differ from the ones traversed
by "go mod tidy". This makes it impossible to run "go mod tidy" pointing the
GOCACHE to the tarball generated by Cachito on Go 1.17.
